715541f-b.text:
(1)
East 131st Street, east from Lexington Ave., to the Harlem River. Also shown is the Lexington and Third Aves. Bridge over the Harlem
River to the Bronx.
March 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, and showing mainly the north side of 131st Street.
March 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

715541f-a.text:
(1)
East 131st Street, east from Lexington Ave., to the Harlem River. Also shown is the Lexington and Third Aves. Bridge over the Harlem
River to the Bronx.
March 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, and showing mainly the north side of 131st Street.
March 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

721128f-a.text:
(1)  Lexington Ave., north from and including East 131st to 132nd Streets.] The buildings shown, are on the Harlem River at 132nd Street.
March 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view of the west side of Lexington Ave. Across this more or less vacant lot, are the bunkers of the Frederick Fuel Corp., which form the north side of 132nd Street and extend towards Park Ave.
March 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

721128f-b.text:
(1)  Lexington Ave., north from and including East 131st to 132nd Streets.] The buildings shown, are on the Harlem River at 132nd Street.
March 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view of the west side of Lexington Ave. Across this more or less vacant lot, are the bunkers of the Frederick Fuel Corp., which form the north side of 132nd Street and extend towards Park Ave.
March 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

715542f-a.text:
131st Street, n.s., w. fr. Lexington Avenue.
Neg. no. A-1245
P. L. Sperr, photographer
April 25, 1941

721127f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue and East 131st Street looking eastwards
towards the Harlem River.
P.L.Sperr,  April 25th,1941

Neg. No. A-911
